required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Population Research of Sublingual Microcirculation Data of Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Population Research of Sublingual Microcirculation Data of Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This study will enrolled 90 healthy volunteers. The sublingual microcirculation will be examined by sidestreamdark-field videomicroscopy (MicroScan;Microvision Medical, Amsterdam, The Netherlands). Five video sequences (20 s) was obtained from different sublingual sites, and digitally stored the images with code numbers that did not reflect volunteers' information for later offline analysis by automated analysis software (AVA 3.0; Academic Medical Centre, University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam, The Netherlands).

primary_outcome.measure: Total small vessel density of sublingual small vessels
primary_outcome.description: Total small vessel density will be measured by Microscan and analyzed by AVA 3.0 software.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perfused small vessel density of sublingual small vessels
secondary_outcome.description: Perfused small vessel density will be measured by Microscan and analyzed by AVA 3.0 software.

arm_group.description: Patients aged from 20 to 39 years old.
Patients aged from 40 to 59 years old.
Patients aged from 60 to 79 years old.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers aged from 20 to 79 years old
- BMI ranged from 18.5 to 27 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Systolic blood pressure > 140 mm Hg, diastolic blood pressure > 95 mm Hg, or systolic blood pressure < 90 mm Hg at enrollment
- Body temperature > 37.5 ℃ or < 35.5 ℃ at enrollment
- had been diagnose with any one of the following diseases
- hypertension
- diabetes mellitus
- peripheral arterial occlusive disease
- coronary arterial disease
- liver cirrhosis
- chronic kidney disease
- stroke
- anemia
- asthma
- chronic bronchitis
- any metabolic diseases
- any hematologic disease
- uncured cancer
- chronic uncontrolled infection
- other disease may limit daily activities
- non-native speakers

facility.name: National Taiwan University Hospital, anesthesiology department
